Identification_Area.version_id:
1.0 hfe_cleaner.py 1.12.0.0 Product_Document
St. Clair, M; Million, C.; Siegler, M. TBD 2019 Simple Python script to ingest source data and send them through reduction pipeline defined by functions in hfe_utils.py and hfe_corrections.py. Running 'python hfe_cleaner.py' in this directory, given an appropriately configured Python 3 environment, will generate a directory tree named 'data_local' that reproduces all data in this bundle's primary data collection. Small modifications to this script can be used to write data out to other filepaths. Dependencies beyond the Python 3 standard library are: astropy, numpy, pandas. The Anaconda distribution of Python is preferred.
TBD 1.0 Initial version.

External_Reference.description: APOLLO 17 HEAT FLOW THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY RDR SUBSAMPLED DATA (PDS3). Data processed by instrument team and archived at NSSDC. This program operates on duplicates of these products included in this collection and uses them for data from 1971-1974.

APOLLO 15 HEAT FLOW THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY RDR SUBSAMPLED DATA (PDS3). Data processed by instrument team and archived at NSSDC. This program operates on duplicates of these products included in this collection and uses them for data from 1972-1974.

External_Reference.reference_text: Nagihara et al., Examination of the Long‚ÄêTerm Subsurface Warming Observed at the Apollo 15 and 17 Sites Utilizing the Newly Restored Heat Flow Experiment Data From 1975 to 1977, JGR Planets 123 (5), May 2018.
External_Reference.description: Data released with publication as Excel spreadsheet. Contains data recovered from ARCSAV tapes. This program operates on a copy of this spreadsheet included in this collection. Used here for data in 1976 and 1977.

Internal_Reference.comment: PDS4-compliant versions of 1975 data released with JGR Planets publication. This program operates on duplicates of these products included in this collection and uses them for data in 1975.

Document.description: Simple Python script to ingest source data and send them through reduction pipeline defined by functions in hfe_utils.py and hfe_corrections.py . Running 'python hfe_cleaner.py' in this directory, given an appropriately configured Python 3 environment, will reproduce and overwrite all data in this bundle's data collection. Small modifications to script can be used to write data out to other filepaths. Dependencies beyond the Python 3 standard library are: astropy, numpy, pandas. The Anaconda distribution of Python is preferred.
